state.response: ایک ستارے کو بنانے والی گیسیں اور دھول عناصر سے تشکیل پاتی ہیں۔
claims: A star is formed from gases and dust.
Gases and dust are composed of elements.

state.response: ایک ستارے کو بنانے والی گیسیں اور دھول عناصر سے تشکیل پاتی ہیں۔
claims: A star is formed from gases and dust.
Gases and dust are composed of elements.

How is a star formed? Star formation process gases and dust

Stars form by the slow contraction under gravity of a very large cloud of gas and dust particles in space. The gas and dust clouds are very common and we know of many regions of star formation in our Milky Way Galaxy.
How is a star formed? Star formation process gases and dust

Stars form from collapsing clouds of gas and dust. Astronomers can train telescopes on giant clouds of hydrogen gas in our own galaxy and find knots of denser, colder gas and dust that are in the process of giving rise to stars. These dust-thick regions of star formation are dark and opaque in visible light.
What elements are gases composed of? What elements are dust composed of?

Elements that exist as gases are mainly found in the upper right corner and on the right side of the periodic table. The following elements exist as gases: H, He, N, O, F, Ne, Cl, Ar, Kr, Xe, and Rn. Thus, half of the halogens, all of the noble gases, and the lightest chalcogens and picnogens are gases.
What elements are gases composed of? What elements are dust composed of?
The elements Hf, Th, Sc, Sm, Ce, La, Mn, Na, K, V, Al and Fe may be considered to be soil-based and contribute about 45–50% to house dust and 87% to street dust.
